${userDisplayName},

We have received a request from ${requestIP} to reset your password. If you have requested to reset your password, please follow the instructions below. If you do not wish to reset your password, simply disregard this message.

* Click the following URL: ${jiveURL}/resetPassword!input.jspa?username=${username}&token=${token}

* Or, go to: ${jiveURL}/resetPassword!input.jspa and enter the following information into the fields provided:

Username : ${username}
Temporary Password : ${token}

template.subject: Welcome to ${SkinUtils.getCommunityName()}, <#if lastNameFirstNameEnabled>${user.firstName!?html}<#else>${user.name!?html}</#if>
template.textBody:
Hi <#if lastNameFirstNameEnabled>${user.firstName!?html}<#else>${user.name!?html}</#if>,
Thanks for joining ${SkinUtils.getCommunityName()}. We're looking forward to your contributions!
Here are some quick tips to help you get started:
Fill out your profile - Help the community get to know you. What are your hobbies? Where did you grow up? Express your personality in the biography section. - Be sure to include any special skills or interests you have in the expertise field. That gives people another way to find and connect with you. - Don't forget to upload your profile picture and an avatar.
<#if (gettingStarted?exists && waterCooler?exists)> Explore the community - The ${waterCooler.name} and the ${gettingStarted.name} spaces are a great place to start. - The ${waterCooler.name} is primarily for non-work related discussions. Here's where you post about that cool weekend project, or discuss a favorite TV show. Remember, you're broadcasting this information at work, so use your best judgment. - ${gettingStarted.name} is great if you just want to try out features on the site, like creating a sample document or discussion.
Start participating - Check out existing discussions to see what people are talking about. See a question you can answer? Post a response. Or start an entirely new discussion. - If there's a document that you send via email constantly, post it to the community. <#else> Start participating - Check out existing discussions to see what people are talking about. See a question you can answer? Post a response. Or start an entirely new discussion. - If there's a document that you send via email constantly, post it to the community.
</#if>
Feel free to contact me directly if you have any questions.
Best Regards<#if primaryCommunityManager?exists>,
${SkinUtils.getDisplayName(primaryCommunityManager)}
${JiveResourceResolver.getJiveObjectEmailURL(primaryCommunityManager, true)} Community Leader</#if>

<#else>

template.name: usercreation.welcome.email
template.description: Email sent to welcome a new user after their account is created by an admin.
template.subject: Welcome to Jive SBS!
template.textBody:
${newUserDisplayName},
Welcome to Jive SBS.
Please use the following credentials<#if jiveURL?has_content > to log in at ${jiveURL}</#if>
username: ${newUserUsername} password: ${password}
Before starting your exploration, there are a couple of concepts you should be familiar with:
1) Tagging - Jive SBS uses tags (which you might know as keywords or categories) extensively to provide rich metadata about discussions, documents and blog posts. It's not required that you use a tag or tags, but it's certainly helpful.
2) Discussions - Got a question or a problem? Can't figure out how to install the latest version of widget xyz? Post a question to the community and let other team members do your work for you.
3) Documents - A document is an easy way to share information with your fellow team members. Use documents in place of Microsoft Word and you'll be happier at the end of the day. Remember that you can always roll back to a prior version of a document and that you can give permissions to other people to help you write a document.
4) Blogs - Got a blog but don't know how you'd use it? A blog is a great way of keeping co-workers and / or team members up to date with what you're working on. Think of your blog as a newsletter where you don't have to manage your subscribers and you can publish as often as you like.
Enjoy!
template.htmlBody:
${newUserDisplayName},

Welcome to Jive SBS.

Please use the following credentials<#if jiveURL?has_content > to log in at ${jiveURL}:

username: ${newUserUsername}
password: ${password}

Before starting your exploration, there are a couple of concepts you should be familiar with:

  1. Tagging - Jive SBS uses tags (which you might know as keywords or categories) extensively to provide rich metadata about discussions, documents and blog posts. It's not required that you use a tag or tags, but it's certainly helpful.
  2. Discussions - Got a question or a problem? Can't figure out how to install the latest version of widget xyz? Post a question to the community and let other team members do your work for you.
  3. Documents - A document is an easy way to share information with your fellow team members. Use documents in place of Microsoft Word and you'll be happier at the end of the day. Remember that you can always roll back to a prior version of a document and that you can give permissions to other people to help you write a document.
  4. Blogs - Got a blog but don't know how you'd use it? A blog is a great way of keeping co-workers and / or team members up to date with what you're working on. Think of your blog as a newsletter where you don't have to manage your subscribers and you can publish as often as you like.

Enjoy!

template.textBody:
Hi ${user.firstName} ${user.lastName},
This email is regarding your account on Research Knowledge Portal.
The password of your account will expire in ${JiveGlobals.getJiveIntProperty("grail.bat.pwd.notification.days",10)} number of days. Kindly change your password to avoid de-activation of your account.
Please follow the below mentioned steps to change your password
1. Login to the Research Knowledge Portal using the link : https://www.batinsights.com 2. Click "Your Stuff" link on user-bar of the Home page of RKP 3. Click on the "Profile" option in the drop down menu 4. On the right side of the page (Under Actions bar), there is an option as "Change password" 5. Clicking the link will redirect you to the screen from where you can change your password 6. Click on "Save" button to save your updated password
Kindly use the updated password for your all future login attempts.
If you have any questions concerning your new account, please feel free to write us at assistance@batinsights.com
Regards, Administrator (Research Knowledge Management Portal)
